para:
GrayData8 objects are used to store ℑ pixels in &oof2; data files. The grayvalues argument contains a Python list of unsigned short integers, representing the gray values of the pixels, starting at the top left of the image and proceeding by rows. That is, the pixels are written in the order described by the following pseudocode:
loop over rows from top to bottom: loop over columns from left to right: write gray
The origin of the name GrayData8 is lost in the mists of time. It should probably be GrayData16. Since it's only used internally in data files, it's not worth changing it.
